Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay; Great location”
Reviews.Author: saurabhrustagi
Reviews.Content: Loved every bit about our stay here. The location is great - very close to blue mosque and hagia sofia. The rooms are very pleasant too. The only thing that needs improvement is the wi-fi in the room. It was quite spotty, and often the signal was quite weak. Apart from that, though, the hotel was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Usamm H
Reviews.Content: Great room, great breakfast, Highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: svince80
Reviews.Content: As other reviews here state, this hotel is located within a 5 minute walk of all the main attractions in central Istanbul - the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Ayia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The room was big enough and clean, and the breakfast was great with a lot of variety. The staff were friendly and helpful. Compared to other hotels in the same area (I stayed in another hotel just around the corner from Erguvan during this trip), it is great value. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Great location from which to see all the sights in the old city of Istanbul- walking distance to everything you'd want to see, especially if you have only a short time in the city. Very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home”
Reviews.Author: annalisa_06081971
Reviews.Content: If you desire to stay in the old side of Istanbul, Erguvan Hotel is a very good choiche: very kind people managing it, new forniture in renovated rooms and a wonderful breakfast! They change towels in bathrooms every day and all spaces are tidy and clean. You can reach Sultan Ahmet by foot in less than 5 minutes. I'm from Italy and I was there in january. Maybe it was a little too warm in the room during the night... but we didnt' ask how to manage the heater!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shoptalk2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simple, but clean, friendly and convenient. I loved the breakfast and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: wgscogen
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this nice "boutique" hotel down a small hill from the Blue Mosque. Nice view of the Marmara Sea, walking distance to all of the main tourist attractions, staff remembered me from a year ago!!! Definitely recommend for those who want to be centrally located for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: carolinevosse
Reviews.Content: It was a very good trip. Thank you. All it's positive and I can recommend this hotel. Erguvan hotel is near of grand bazar, the blue mosque. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: As other travelers stated, the hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to many major sites in the historic old city. The hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly & helpful. We arrived early & were shown to our room right away. The room was very clean, a comfortable size, big bathroom with tub/shower. We enjoyed the breakfast in the top floor dining room which has a great view from the patio.The concierge helped us book an overnight excursion to Cappadocia & arranged tickets to a whirling dervish performance. We travel a lot & found the Erguvan to be among the best of small hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: MelaniePF
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The smaller, non-tourist-y feel...the neighborhood was wonderful and so close to the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, TopkapÄ± Palace, and more. Loved the breakfast buffet and sitting on the balcony of the restaurant. Homey and laid-back. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and generous”
Reviews.Author: George J
Reviews.Content: We felt your staff in the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Also, the hotel is very generous. We arrived in the morning of the first day of our stay and we were offered breakfast. Unfortunately we had already eating but appreciate the gesture very much. The place is clean and very conveniently located. We'll probably stay there again in our next trip to Istanbul (my girlfriend lives in Ankara ;>)

Reviews.Title: “Good location-Hotel need improvement”
Reviews.Author: ABCDEFG_1234
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for istanbul. Right in the centre and close by all historic sites. It was relatively easy to find. Pros: Location Terrace gave a nice view Ability to control heating locally was a benefit especially on cold days Lift Safe hotel Safe neighbourhood Close to public transport Cons: Not enough lighting in the bedrooms Towels were worn out for a 4 star hotel Bathroom door was difficult to close Bidet was pointing the wrong way Small things that you would expect in a hotel were missing such as: shower cap/daily replenishment of soap/shampoo. Breakfast was adequate - not much variety - lots of cheese and bread For the price we paid, Im sure we could have found better quality elsewhere in Turkey. Bedrooms need updating Overall it was OK and did the purpose, however, improvements can be made so that you feel you spent your money well.

Reviews.Title: “Erguvan stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Corina M
Reviews.Content: Erguvan is such a charming hotel that lived up and exceeded our expectations. What a lovely stay we had! the staff is great and very helpful with anything you need. The rooms are clean with very comfortable beds, I slept wonderfully the whole time. The breakfast is perfect, with lots of fruit, breads, cheeses, and deserts! The location could have not been better, we were close to all the historical sites within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again! Thank you Erguvan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanValjean78
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we've been in Istanbul. The staff was helpful, the breakfast was good, and the room was charming. The hotel is conveniently located near the hippodrome and Blue Mosque. And, it's got plenty of street parking - a definite bonus for us. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeClef
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel, and a great value for the money, which is somewhat hidden but only slightly off the beaten path. It is just down a little hill from the Sultanahmet district, the most important district of Istanbul as far as the main tourist attractions are concerned. It is necessary to walk up a slight incline for about 50 yards to get to the main square, so this hotel might not be ideal for disabled or elderly persons. But once you're up the hill, everything is spread out before you. The most famous Mosques and architectural sites, the great little Turkish cafeterias for a cheap and delicious meal, other great restaurants and cafes. Once you're at the main square of Sultanahmet, it's only about a 10 minute walk, leisurely and very interesting, to the Grand Bazaar. The Hotel Erguvan has great service. The people at the desk were always very friendly and happy to answer any questions and give advice. The breakfast was lavish and served on the rooftop of the hotel, which has a fabulous view of the harbor. Getting to the Erguvan hotel, from the main railway station or the airport, and through no fault of the hotel, can be a problem. Getting anyplace, for a stranger unfamiliar with public transportation, can be a problem because of the predatory taxi drivers. Almost all refuse to use the meter and instead offer a "special rate", which turns out to be an exorbitant amount for the distance traveled. Insist that your cab engage the meter. I turned away at least 3 cabs, and their "special rates", before I found one which would actually use the meter. Just be patient and firm.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: LancashireSuem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with another couple,( we are middish(!) 50's), for three nights early October. We travelled scheduled with Turkish Airlines from Manchester - would recommend them. First time I remember actually enjoying an in flight meal for ages, and the seats were comfy too. Anyway, the hotel. I booked it direct having checked it out on TA. The booking was easy to do, the hotel responding promptly to my emails. As we stayed 3 nights we had complementary airport transfers and were also given a discount on the room charges for payment in cash - euros. Istanbul airport is large and very busy and we did wait a while for our lift to leave but we were promptly met and duly delivered to the hotel. As we arrived,early evening, a local street market was on going by the hotel which added to the whole scene. The hotel is in the older, Sutanhamet, area, and it really felt that I had arrived somewhere different. Check - in was swift and friendly, and we then adjourned to the roof terrace, off the breakfast room, as the sun set, to enjoy a nice chilled glass of wine.( Do check at restaurants, before you sit down, as to whether or not they serve alcohol. This is a Muslim country remember, and certainly those within the shadow of the main mosques may well not serve it). The sunset over the Bosphorus was superb, as was the view of the Blue Mosque from the side terrace. We retired there each day for sundowners - lovely. While mentioning the breakfast room, I would say that breakfast itself is adaquate, but they could complement it with some more fresh fruit perhaps. It's basically a savoury run and a sweet run with cakes,breads, and jams etc. There's tea and coffee and fruit juice. The rooms are a very good standard. Not large but a good size, very nicely furnished, and comfortable. There's also a lift to the upper floors.The morning call to prayers can be a bit noisy, but you can just turn over! The hotel is excellently placed for the main visitor attractions. All within very easy walking distance. We had a guide for a day - which the hotel will organise for you. It was a busy and informative day, and our guide got us into places quickly, using the locals' entrances.Brain was reeling a bit at the end of the day, but would recommend it, and it does give you a much better feel of where you are and it's history. It cost the four of us 100euros. Thought that the smaller Spice Bazar was better than the Grand Bazar, and the trip along the Bosphorus gave a very good feel of the sheer size, and variety of lifestyles going on in this city. It is ancient and modern, as well as east meets west. The Cisterns are worth a visit too, but at the end of the day this is all personal choice. Also, head towards the Blue Mosque and just wander around the local area at your own pace. We did and found a lovely little local bazar at the top of the road, and a lovely little area of nice cafes etc and hotels a bit further on. You can also walk down to the river through this area. The hotel are helpful for this and have maps they can give you. We left Istanbul after 3 days, (our return airport transfer was right on time and although it was 5am, we were waved off by our friendly receptionist), and flew on to Ercan in Northern Cyprus for a further 4 days at the Bellapais Gardens hotel in Bellapais village. We have been there before. It's so good I hesitate to tell you about it. Will be reviewing that again. Again, flew there with Turkish Airlines, (about a 1 hour flight). We were at the pool by 10.30am!! All in all would not hesitate to recommend the Erguvan to you. would give it 4.5 if could. Feel free to email me with any queries.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JPatelNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Erguvan for close to a week in August and loved it. We picked the hotel because it was close to the key historic sites, which helped us beat the cruise liner rush in the mornings. The hotel was very clean and welcoming. The staff was very helpful, gave us the best map of the city and pointed out key locations and places to eat. Breakfast was very nice, a majority of the dishes seemed to be home made, which made the entire place smell of baking in the afternoons. The view from the hotel was beautiful. An unexpected bonus: during Ramadan the Hippodrome is home to a fair with a flea market, food vendors, and live entertainment. It was fantastic way to spend our evenings.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice breakfast with a view”
Reviews.Author: MollyLA
Reviews.Content: Get there early for breakfast, its a lovely view from the terrace! Nearby Doy Doy restaurant is kind of bland for vegetarians, I recommend Khorosani, which is a 10 minute walk for vegetarians. For really lovely shawls, towels, and hand made soaps, go to the family run business Yilmaz Ipekcilik which is near Topkapi Palace entrance of Gullhane Park. They make their own silk and hand weave all the textiles they sell at very reasonable prices. It's also about a 10 minute walk from the hotel in the area that has beautiful old wooden houses that have been reconverted into hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This was a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tiz33
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located in the old quarter, close to many of the attractions and public transport. Staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and they speak English. Hotel has good facilities plus free internet - computer supplied! Breakfast is Turkish, so dont expect an English one.Ask staff to tell you of the places to visit, this was more useful than the tourist books. Arrange your own cab to the hotel from the airport L35.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurowent
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Hotel Erguvan were very clean and cozy. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast served on the roof terrace offered a great view of the Sea of Marmaris. The location is very good, about 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque. We would absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Tashfiq
Reviews.Content: Great and pleasant place.Not very luxurious but very cozy and comfortable.Nice location close to most of the major tourist spots.The manager,Eyub is very friendly and helpful.Overall everyone treates their guest with utmost respect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlecougar
Reviews.Content: Located down from the Arasta Bazaar,on a quiet side street, this hotel has small but very clean rooms. One side faces the Marmara Sea while the other sides have street views. The breakfast is a typical Turkish breakfast with the usual yogurt, olives, tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, cereal and assorted pastries. The staff is very friendly, low keyed, and helpful with arranging taxis or giving trip suggestions when asked. We would have stayed here when we came in May except the prices were substantially higher by May.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: HowardWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The Erguvan is a satisfactory hotel, but it is not close to being the 4 star establishment it claims to be. We stayed earlier in the month at the Hotel Seraglio. That hotel was somewhat cheaper, better located, and had far friendlier and helpful people at the desk than the Erguvan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - very clean - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarieMalmo
Reviews.Content: The trip from the airport takes about 30 min (no rush hour) and the hotel is easy to find for the driver and very well located. 5 min walk to Blue Mosque (albeit up a little climb but all of Istanbul is either up or down). The staff is very helpful and gave out maps and had suggestions on where to go sight seeing and how to use the public transportation (very easy and inexpensive). The rooms are nice and very clean and have hard flooring and discreet wall papers. Yes, you can hear noisy co travellers if they are rambling around in the stairs and hallways at night (which perhaps is more a lack of consideration from their side than a hotel problem) - but the hotel seems to attract fairly low key people and not young party ones or families with children which makes the "noise issue" mentioned by previous reviewers very small. And in Istanbul it is a good idea to bring the ear plugs any way since the calls for prayers might disturb. Breakfast was ok - the view from the tables outside is very nice. (However dont leave any food on the table since the seagulls are preying). There is a local hamam (open 800-2300) just around the corner - 50 lira for a relax, scrub and soaping experience and another 30 for a 30 min massage -which is a very nice experience. The female bathers are taken care of by two sisters who dont speak any english at all but are very nice. There is a food/water shop just across the street from the hotel that is open late.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quite place, very helpful staff. The breakfast was OK, but the juice could have been colder.”
Reviews.Author: hannepatur
Reviews.Content: A small and nice hotel for couples, in walking distance to most of the large attractions. The staff helped us a lot with tickets for a jazz concert , sightseeing tour and good advices,

Reviews.Title: “A nice traditional hotel, not very luxurious but comfortable and very well located.”
Reviews.Author: Cecezzle
Reviews.Content: The staff : was always available to answer our questions and help us. The hotel : was well located, near the metro and just behind the blue mosquee. The room : was a little bit small but comfortable. The bad point goes for the bathroom, very small and with the toilets inside. Another point, the soundproofing inside the room really needs to be improved. I think that the problem comes from the door. At last : the breakfast was pretty good and various.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: janvj
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, very good breakfast, serviceminded personell, short way to attractions, and a very nice view from the terrace. Only one thing, the wifi could have been faster. I specially recommend you to visit Topkapi Museum, Dolmabahce Palace, Grand Bazaar and the shoppingstreet Istiklal. Good shopping is turkish carpets - beautiful, good quality, and interesting negotiation about the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: idawood
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with reasonable amenities. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn't like the decor of the room due to dark wall paper but of course it is about personal taste. I will recommend this hotel if you would like to stay in Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Small family hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Avtobus
Reviews.Content: Spending there weekend. The hotel is very nice and has foot access to top historical monuments in Istanbul. Breakfast was poor. Service very good, nice people and helpful. Price performance. Booking thru hotels.com for weekend stay for two person 120â‚¬.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: menhirkultur
Reviews.Content: I visited Erguvan hotel for five nights in beginning of November 2010 and enjoyed my stay. The rooms are very clean and nicely furnished. It has a perfect location close to most sights. The only things they can do better is: - WiFi Internet doesn't work very well - The doors to the rooms are not soundproof at all so you will probably hear everything that is said in the reception and staircase during night (can probably be easily fixed by the hotel by putting some carpets on the floor in the stairwell to avoid echos) - All food on the breakfast buffÃ© has the same temperature. To avoid gastric problems it would be better if the hot food was hot and the cold was cold. With the exception of food temperature I enjoyed the breakfast, especially the cheese... I do really recommend this hotel - good hotel, perfect location and a attractive price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: remlez
Reviews.Content: You are very I near the historical attractions and can do nearly eveything in walking. It is al lot up and down so. There is a bit of traffic noise !

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 68Tiziana
Reviews.Content: Confortable hotel with large clean rooms, very near the centre of Istanbul. Good breakfast, polite staff (except for one girl at the reception).

Reviews.Title: “location, location and location”
Reviews.Author: giantdino
Reviews.Content: walking distance to everywhere! friendly staff. room is small but functional. the only thing we don't like is the unstable wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Change in Reservation without Notification”
Reviews.Author: MadridDevera
Reviews.Content: I booked a large double seaview room with Erguvan 2 months before my departure date and sent an e-mail reminding them of my arrival one wk. out, and was told all was in order. When I arrived I was told that my first night would have to be spent in a single room This room had no view and was exceptionally small and located in a distant corner. The staff though indicated only one room number on my hotel bill. I was so distraught at the appearance of this room that I was supposed to stay in for one night, that I took my luggage that I hadn't unpacked and checked into another hotel at about 6:00 p.m. for one night! It was my vacation and the small room was horrible. I checked into the Amira (around the corner) for one night, which was 20 euros more but was outstanding. I want to add that I always pay my hotel bill when I arrive so I paid not only for the Erguvan on my first night but the 2nd hotel. Also, when I arrived I had to request to not be charged as much for the smaller room. You might ask, why did you accept when you arrive? I was tired and caught off guard but came to my senses after returning to the Erguvan for the evening after walking around Sultanamet. The Erguvan is well situated and clean but the supervisor difinitely made a mess of my reservation this time. I've stayed at this hotel 4 times before this last incident. Finally the night clerk never has the correct bill. Five times during early morning checkout, he has asked me if I've paid for an item that was settled during the day! Next time, I'll book somehwere else as there are many new hotels in the area that really are 4 star because they have more modern accomodations. The Erguvan's selling point is the seaview on the terrace where there are dining accomodations. This blunder may have been just poor planning by the supervisor and should never have happened!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegRob
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 5 nights at the Erguvan Hotel Istanbul in October 2010. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is extremely well located to visit all the sites in Sultanahmet. Breakfast, which is included was plentiful with a good variety of foods available, the coffee was superb. This is a small hotel so donâ€™t expect large rooms. We felt quite comfortable in our room. The bed was very comfortable and everything was clean. We would stay at this hotel again. The front desk staff were great at giving us directions and booked several tours for us. The complimentary drinks when we arrived was a very nice gesture

Reviews.Title: “High class, familiar and central”
Reviews.Author: 1meweb
Reviews.Content: Excellent little Hotel in the old centre of Istanbuls attractions (Sultan Achmed, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Cisterne etc.). 5 Min walk to the Tram-Way. Rooms are clean and nice equipped. Service excellent. Wonderful terrace with a beautiful view to Suiltan Achmed Mosque and to the Marmara Sea. Despite windows to the street quiet. Look at the website, itÂ´s very ok and characterises the Hotel and its facilities well.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, really made our trip”
Reviews.Author: annas_london
Reviews.Content: The Erguvan hotel is a great place to stay in Istanbul. It is in a good location, 5 minutes walk from the centre of Sultanahmet. The staff were friendly and helpful, and very accomadating to our family group of 9 who stayed there for a week. The highlight was the terrace on the roof where we ate breakfast in the morning and had drinks in the evening- the hotel will also cook dinner on the terrace in the evening if requested.

Reviews.Title: “So charming and personalized... The Erguvan is great!”
Reviews.Author: professorwach
Reviews.Content: The Sultanahmet in Istanbul is the historical district, and if you're looking for a charming hotel that reflects this feel of the neighborhood, look no further than Erguvan! Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by Eyub. I have never met a friendlier person in a hotel! He spoke English extremely well and took the time to give us maps and acquaint us with the neighborhood. He proved to be very helpful over our stay as well! Our room was overlooking the street (and you could see the Sea of Marmara from our windows as well) on the third floor. Our room was large for European standards. It was very clean and had a lot of windows and sunlight. The only complaint I have is that the bed was hard as a rock! But after touring the city all day I feel asleep so easily, the bed softness didn't really matter... Breakfast buffet (cheeses, bread, cereal, spreads, boreks, meats, coffee, juice, pastries) was included each morning on the rooftop terrace. The terrace overlooked the sea and the Blue Mosque and it was wonderful to start our day here each morning! The hotel also has a small elevator which is really helpful for getting luggage up and down! I really enjoyed the feel and service of this unique boutique hotel and I would stay here again in the future! P.S. There is free WIFI and free use of a computer in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: MaartenVWM
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, close to the blue mosque, within walking distance of the Haja Sofia and the Topkapi Palace. The staff is great. We arrived at 1130pm and we asked if it was still possible to have a drink on the roof terrace. The receptionist told us the terrace was closing but he phoned upstairs and arranged for the terrace to be open a little longer. And the drinks were on the house! The next day we got free maps and a lot of advice for sightseeing. Breakfast is also served on the roof. The selection is good. The rooms are very clean and and everything looks new. Rooms have windows with double glass, so most of the street noise will stay outside. Besides that, some of the other rooms face a small inner courtyard so they should be even quiet. There's a pc in the lobby with free internet and there's also Wifi in the building. Our flight left late in the evening , we checked out at noon and left our luggage with the hotel. W\hen we came back to the hotel to pick up our luggage we were offered a room so we could take a quick shower before heading to the airport. .

Reviews.Title: “Just the right place”
Reviews.Author: hamsho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this small hotel for three nights. The staff was very friendly and responsive. The room was bright and clean. The breakfast spread (included in the price) was great with local and more traditional offerings. The location was just right, near most of the tourist attractions. The view from the roof, where breakfast is served, was great overlooking the sea, the town and few mosques. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lies to get you in the door”
Reviews.Author: clani
Reviews.Content: We had two awful nights at Erguvan. I had made a reservation 6 months prior to our recent stay at Erguvan. In our emails, I inquired about the family suite. I emphasized that my teenaged kids were tall and needed full twin beds and that they were too big to sleep in cots or pull-out beds. I asked if the family suite had 2 full twins for my children and the manager said yes, they were 2 full twins. When we arrived, we found a queen sized bed, a cot and a pull-out. My children were uncomfortable for 2 nights. There were no other options as the hotel was full. Furthermore, one night a drunk guest knocked on our door at four in the morning, waking us up. She had the wrong room. The following night, the same party of guests were noisy all night long. The thin doors at Erguvan are useless against any noise in the hallways. Most hoteliers in Turkey are very hospitality, but some will say anything to get you in the door. Unfortunately, when you're booking from far away, you sometimes fall for their lies.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: rizarnp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul- a wonderful location as it is close to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace and the Grand Bazaar. I most enjoyed the hotel's rooftop terrace as it had great views of the harbor, and the Blue Mosque. I ate dinner there two of the three evenings I stayed there, and the food was tasty and reasonably priced. All the staff was friendly, and courteous. At the reception area, the two people I dealt with were Cidem and Hakan who both speak English fluently. In the terrace restaurant area, one of the staff's English was not as proficient ( and my Turkish is sadly deficient), but even with a small language barrier we were made to feel welcome,and had delightful evenings there. All in all, this is a small hotel that makes the traveler feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, value”
Reviews.Content: The front desk made excellent recommendations for the Bosphorous River Cruise, Turkish bath, Whirling Dervish experience and neighborhood restaurants. Wonderful breakfast, terrific views from the rooftop, free wifi and computer in lobby. Close to the sites of historic Istanbul. On Wednesday there is farmer's market across the street from the hotel. We had a room with three single beds - wished the third bed was a mattress instead of just a cot with springs. Bathroom was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Tim1453
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a very pleasant week at this hotel in Istbul. Following this we moved north of the Golden Horn to the Istanbul Hilton. The difference could not have been more dramatic. The Erguvan was by far the better experience. The Hilton did a reasonable job of doing what 5-star hotels do. It insulated us from Istanbul, charged us 57 Lira each for a very nice breakfast buffet, etc.... but the Erguvan. At the Erguvan we were emersed in old Istanbul from the call to prayer at dawn, to leaning out the window watching the neighbors play or looking on at the neighborhood weekly 'farmers market.' It was a short, easy walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia with easy access to the tram system. The neighborhood felt safe and the local neighbors friendly. The room was pleasant and had just what I expected. It was always clean. The breakfast buffet was very reasonable and the cost perfect (included with the room). The choices were reasonable but did not change over the course of the week. No reservations in recommending this hotel to any tourist not looking for an insulated Hilton experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, walking...”
Reviews.Author: Gbsoomro
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, walking distance to major attractions & tram stations. The rooms were very clean and the complementary breakfast was great. All the staff spoke English and extremely helpful in every way. We stayed there for 4 days and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy central hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOKOGA
Reviews.Content: After having attended a conferance at the Hilton, me and my girlfriend moved down to Sultanahmet. This hotel was a pearl! Nice staff, centrally located, clean, good breakfast and we had a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Not welcome”
Reviews.Author: mumontherun
Reviews.Content: This should have rated a â€œfourâ€� from me, but I canâ€™t recall the last time I encountered service this poor. Good points: Location â€“ within a few minutesâ€™ walk of the major tourist attractions of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Basilica Sistern; great if you only have a very short time, as we did. Located in an â€œokayâ€� neighbourhood, with restaurants nearby. Rooms â€“ spartan for a supposed 4-star, but pleasant, modern and reasonably well-equipped, with double-glazed windows, okay curtains, hair dryer, TV with satellite channels, mini-bar and in-room safe. Bad points: The service. See below. The price â€“ we were quoted 120 Euros if paid by cash and 140 if paid by card, which was very expensive for a place that was really only 3-star. You pay for the location. In-hotel noise was very audible from inside the room and was more disturbing than the outside noise. We had booked a standard room with two beds, as I was travelling with my teenage daughter. When we arrived, the clerk informed us he was â€œupgradingâ€� us from a standard room to a â€œsea viewâ€� room with a king bed, as the hotel was full and they only had that room or a single room left. Faced with this incompetence, we had little choice but to accept. We discussed an airport transfer for the next morning, and I booked the transfer for 11.30am so that I would be able to pay at the hotel and not have to deal with Turkish taxi drivers. Incidentally, the clerk did not pose the usual question of â€œhow do you intend to payâ€�, so avoided reminding me about their â€œdiscountâ€� for cash. The staff member who then â€œshowedâ€� us to our rooms threw our suitcases into the lift, sprinted up the stairs and literally â€œshowedâ€� us our room â€“ he pointed at the door, then left. I was startled by this brusqueness, as even in lesser-starred hotels it is usual for a staff member to open your room, check everything is okay, point out the mini-bar and show you how the TV works. The next morning, I was similarly taken aback by the indifference of the breakfast staff, who appeared to studiously ignore the guests. Heavenâ€™s sake, guys! A smile costs nothing, and you donâ€™t need a translator! In addition to apparently not being interested in greeting guests or letting them know what options were available, they left empty trays of food/bowls of yoghurt un-replenished. The choices were only okay, too, certainly nothing special. After feeling less than welcomed, we checked out (having to pay by card since I had forgotten about the cash discount - watch out for their sharp practice of converting their Euro price into Turkish Lira at who-knows-what exchange rate before running it through the EFTPOS machine), and enquired about the airport transfer we had booked. Shake of the head. â€œNot here till 12.â€� Short discussion followed, but no, the transfer vehicle was otherwise engaged, leaving me with no option but to get a taxi â€“ the very last thing I wanted to do in Istanbul. Of course, the inevitable happened â€“ we had to endure just about every thieving Istanbul Taxi driver trick in the book. I wonâ€™t bore you with the details, but the taxi driver in question (TPL09, by the way) tried four identifiable cons, including the note-change trick and trying to lock my 14-year-old daughter in the car. I didnâ€™t let him get away with any of them, but ended up very shaken after the ensuing shouting match. Why blame the hotel for that, I hear you ask? Because it was a situation that I knew existed and tried my best to avoid, and if the hotel staff had had the decency and competence to inform me ahead of time that they could not fill my transfer booking, I would have organised to take the airport shuttle or the train. So, all up, forget the Erguvan. Even for the location, it's not worth it. Go somewhere you are welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Describe this hotel in one word? "Perfect!"”
Reviews.Author: Beth_Aviano_Italy
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel situated in an ideal location, managed with utmost care & service, and ran by an excellent, friendly, and warm staff, then you don't need to look any further, Hotel Erguvan is the only option for you! It is located in walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, where you can shop until you absolutely drop =), and a skip and a hop away from this restaurant with fantastic food, great price and perfect view of the Blue Mosque (request to eat at the top floor!!) --- DoyDoy Restaurant! Make sure to meet Moses, the manager, while you're there. He will make you laugh! Erguvan Hotel has a lovely/spacious lobby with a flatscreen tv, lounge area, and a computer desk equipped with free internet service. There's a patio outside as well, if you prefer to chill out in fresh air. There's a lift/elevator available so you don't have to worry about dragging your luggage up to your rooms. But when we arrived, one of the staff members helped us bring our luggage up, and that was the first of many more impressive gestures of hospitality they gave us. The rooms were very clean; the mattress, bed sheets/pillows were so comfortable! The toilet had decent space with a nice shower/tub. The staff turned the beds and brought us fresh towels daily. There is also a safe for you to secure your valuable items in the room. Flatscreen tv/satellite channels, fridge/mini bar, closet with extra pillows, disposable foot slippers were also found in our rooms and just added extra warmth to our stay there. If you request a room with a sea view, you will not be disappointed. The view was absolutely breath-taking! I was able to take great pictures, especially when the sun was setting! The breakfast area is on the top floor, with an outside terrace that overlooks the exquisite view of the sea and best of all, the Blue Mosque!!! And trust me, when they serve breakfast, they serve breakfast. It will not be your typical European breakfast of simpy coffee and brioche/croissant. They had a buffet-style breakfast with various sorts of pastries (Try the cheese borek! uh-hmm, delicious!), fruits, cereal, cheese, veggies, and other hors d' oeuvres (boiled eggs/ sausages). Of course, there's plenty of coffe, juice, tea and milk! The best part of this hotel is its staff --- EyÃ¼p, the concierge, and Hakan Ã¶ner, the manager, are just awesome! =) They're very informative, courteous and helpful. They are always willing and ready to answer your questions. They even assisted us with our transportation to/from the airport, booking a Belly Dancing course, and suggesting great restaurants (including one with dinner a show!). I have so much more great things to say about this hotel but I think you get the point. I seriously doubt our trip would have been this fabulous if we didn't stay here. It is something special when you're in a foreign country but you feel right at home. These guys surely did that for us!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Masirahqueen
Reviews.Content: Erguvan hotel is definitely the cream of the crop! My friends and I (6 ladies) spent 3 nights at this hotel in April 2010. It was the highlight of our stay in Istanbul. Hakkan and his staff (Ayub etc) are definitely the best! It is wonderful when you meet people who love what they do ... and they definitely do! Their recommendations for dinner were perfect, their suggestions for places to visit were superb, and their hospitality and excitement about our visit were contagious! We had 2 rooms at the hotel with one room overlooking the Blue mosque and the Marmara sea which is the same view from the terrace where delicious breakfast were served. A sample of the Turkish cuisine, the Borek were cooked to perfection and definitely a pleasant surprise. We loved the fresh fruits, baked goods as well as the coffee. The bed was very comfortable and clean. St Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar were about 5-10 minute walk. The Doy-doy restaurant around the corner is a â€œmust eatâ€� restaurant with delicious kebaps, desserts and great Turkish coffee! My friends and I will treasure this extraordinary and memorable experience we had in Istanbul. We definitely had a blast. I have visited over 10 countries in Europe and I definitely recommend this hotel. Erguvan hotel had surpassed all my hotel expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PaulkMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 12. Very clean and tidy. Located near Blue Mosque and easy walks to Grand Bazaar and St Sophia. Room had all facilities required including WiFi. No problems with noise for sleeping. Service was excellent. Good advice re tours and sightseeing. We arrived at 8am and were invited to have coffee in the breakfast room after checking in. Great value. looking forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With a Homey Environment and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: asamet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Erguvan Hotel for a total of 5 nights (end of March 2010). We really enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is very clean and the room where we stayed was spacious with a sea view. The bathroom was very clean. There was a flat panel TV which we hardly used since we had wireless internet access and during our stay in the room we were usually surfing the net. In the lobby of the hotel, there is a computer connected to the internet for those who do not have their laptops.The hotel staff was very nice. Since we were traveling to other parts of Turkey, we did not want to take all of our luggage with us. The staff was very kind to let us store our belongings until we returned to Istanbul and checked in again at the hotel. This allowed us travel light within Turkey. Even though we stayed in some other excellent 5 star Chain Hotels during our trip, we really felt at home when we went back to Erguvan for the last few days in Istanbul. I would like to thank all the staff of Erguvan Hotel for making our stay enjoyable and in particular Mr. Hakan with whom I exchanged several emails in preparation for this trip. He is very professional and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stampeders
Reviews.Content: The Erguvan is in a great location, close to all the major sites - all within walking distance. The hotel has an excellent rooftop terrace, and great breakfast. The rooms are fairly large and well furnished. The staff was excellent - very helpful with tours, restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. Good restaurants nearby, free internet in the lobby. Highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a great place to stay, easy walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: knitinoz
Reviews.Content: Our kids were 9 and 7 when we stayed at the Erguvan and they enjoyed it too, friendly staff, clean rooms great breakfast and lovely views at night from the balcony. They also picked us up from airport which was wonderful not having been to Istanbul before and the thought of Friday night traffic well that was taken care of for us. Easy walk to everything and with only 3 days there this time I will stay longer and at the Erguvan next time around. Really who goes to a hotel in Istanbul to do work or swim there are too many other things to do and visit. There was internet to keep in touch with family & friends though.

Reviews.Title: “Much to recommend”
Reviews.Author: BwanaBunduki
Reviews.Content: Brief review - room small but very clean and well serviced every day. No bath, but decent shower. Bed comfortable. Mini bar. Cable TV, but not many English language channels. Good sized safe in room. Aircon. 3 power sockets - good for charging gadgets. Front of house staff excellent. Will arrange airport transfer for 30 euro - not sure how that compares to taxis, but recently paid Â£15 for the 2 miles to hotel near LHR, so could be worse. Breakfasts good. Dinners poor and overpriced, but there are lots of local restaurants. However, nice view of Blue mosque from terrace. Easy walking distance of all major sights in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kennedy112
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel very close to the center of the old part of Istanbul. Attractions such as the Blue Mosque Grand Bazaar and the ancient underground Cistern were all within walking distance. (Just turn right out of the front door) We found the hotel to be very clean and well maintained and everything was in good order. The room was serviced every day including clean linen and included both mini bar, direct-line telephone and TV. The reception staff were both friendly and helpful with advice regarding where to go and what to do. We would go back......

Reviews.Title: “Champagne quality on beer budget”
Reviews.Author: wannabe_jetset
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. A+ location. Perfectly situated in Sultanamet but in the nice, not seedy, part of town. A stone's throw from all the sights. Spotless, renovated rooms. Ours had a sea view. Free internet in the lobby which was a big plus. Morning breakfast was plentiful, healthy and delicious. The best part of all was the kindness and helpfulness of the front desk staff. They took Turkish hospitality to the next level. They also connected me to a local travel agency (Pasifik) which seamlessly organized my travels to Ephesus and Capadoccia. I'll be recommending this hotel and their travel agency without hesitation to my friends/ family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: UNL
Reviews.Content: Very good value, good location, quiet, friendly, great roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for those hidden extras...”
Reviews.Author: Brian24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more or less what we expected from reading other reviews but the rooms (we had asked for a triple for extra space, having heard the rooms were small) are rather functional and spartan - and the beds very hard(!) to get used to. Our room was also next to the lift/stairs on the first floor so there was a lot of noise from other guests. The breakfast buffet was very mean & mediocre too, even for a 3-star hotel. We also found the staff rather (apart from one guy who spoke good English) indifferent - more concerned with watching the international football on TV in the reception area with their cronies than manning the desk. Our main gripe was with the Euro/Lira conversion rate however - they charged us 3 Lira to one Euro (not 2 as elsewhere in Istanbul) on the exit tab for drinks - then ramped up our quoted 45TL cab pick-up from Ataturk to 65TL without explanation - we were delayed inbound but I don't think that justifies a 20 Lira waiting surcharge, if that's what it was. This is sharp practice - so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Erguvan!”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler94
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just downhill from the Blue Mosque, making it an excellent location for exploring some of Istanbul's most popular sights. The breakfast is substantial and delicious and eaten on the terrace if the weather is cooperating. What made this hotel so special, however, is the staff. My friend and I waited 24 hours for our luggage to arrive due to an airline mishap; the staff at the Erguvan made multiple phone calls to advocate for us. Overall -- outstanding value, very clean rooms, and excellent staff at the Erguvan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LottieMidlands
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul, hotel organised for us to met at airport very efficiently. Staff very helpful. Great view from roof terrace of Blue Mosque and sunset. Room clean and well appointed. Hotel bar prices in euros not turkish lire!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable value in the old city”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eguvan is a small comfortable hotel located down the hill towards the Bosphorus from the Blue Mosque. It is situated in a traditional neighborhood of homes and restuarants and is a ten-minute climb up the hill from the main tourist area. The area is quiet and safe, only a little street work and the weekly farmer's market set disturb the mornings. The hotel is tricky to find even with a navigation system: take a map and write down th address for taxi drivers. Check-in is warm and personal, and the staff is full of information, guidebooks, and restaurant recommendations. They are willing to arrange for dinners and for you to be picked up and returned, their suggestions were uniformly good. The lobby is dim and quiet, but the roof terrace is spectacular: a panoramic view of the the neighborhood and shipping lanes. Breakfast in this setting is a real treat every morning, and the Turkish selection of pastries, meats, cheeses, and coffee is very good. Rooms are traditonal, small and cozy, with clean but minimal amenities. The shower stall was small but with good hot water and pressure. The bed was firm and the covers were light; there was a small desk and television, minibbar and wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: JourneyGirlOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Erguvan Hotel for 7 nights. Room was clean, staff was friendly and helpful, location is great, and neighbourhood is interesting. Breakfast on the terrace was nice, though heard from friends at other similar hotels about much more elaborate offerings. Was glad to have WiFi in the room. Airport pick-up was included in the rate (staying longer than 3 nights), and arranged reasonable price for return to the airport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iantw7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is with walking distance of the main sights and restaurants,it's very clean and the staff are helpfull.I would give it a higher rating except that the rooms are quite noisey ,you can hear the other guest moving around in their rooms quite a bit.I also found the breakfast buffet a bit poor,it needs a bit more choice and to be a bit fresher,but its only a short walk to have breakfast in a cafe looking out over the blue mosque

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value, excellent service - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: michael_b_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Erguvan Hotel recently, for a short break in Istanbul. The hotel is in a good location for visiting the old city with all its sights and attractions - in 5 minutes you're at the Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sophia, but be aware it's quite a steep walk. As with the rest of the hotel, our room was spotless and nicely decorated, with everything in working order. The hotel is small and we got excellent service from the staff who are all really helpful. There are no special amenities or facilities, but as the base for visiting Istanbul it's perfect. And as a bonus if you're staying for more than 3 nights, the hotel will pick you up from the airport. There's also free wi-fi throughout, plus free Internet access in the shared area near reception. Would definitely recommend the Erguvan Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice to see historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MJ34
Reviews.Content: If you would like a very reasonably priced hotel located near the attractions of historical Istanbul this is an excellent choice. I would not choose this hotel if you are expecting luxury or business facilities or something very romantic, but if you want a pleasant, helpful staff, with a good buffet breakfast, fine location, and attractive, clean rooms, this would be an excellent choice. The hotel is close to the Blue Mosque - you can see it from the breakfast patio. I stayed for a week and had a very good time. There is a computer in the lobby and when I needed to print my boarding pass the manager let me use his computer. The staff speaks good English and they are very helpful. And several cats visit the outdoor breakfast patio - do give them a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: slavikovaCoventry
Reviews.Content: Great position in the old part of the city. Next door building works somewhat noisy but they finished by 5pm, so it didn't matter, we had it only 1 day - a lazy pm after a Turkish bath experience. If you book directly from their website, they collect from the airport for free.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - doesn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: ThereIsAWill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ridiculously close to the Blue Mosque - barely a 2 minute walk (albeit uphill). It has both a beautiful view of the water and of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop restaurant which has an excellent breakfast (included in the cost of the room) you could stuff your face on and also serves lunch, dinner, and late evening drinks. Rooms are a bit sparse but they'll do. You shouldn't be spending too much time in your room when in Istanbul anyway. If you ask for a triple, make sure there are actually three beds, not 1 small bed and a cot (it wasn't too comfortable). Or get a 2nd room.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: rosie043
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel firiendly and helpful staff spotless room with view of Bosporus A great venue for the main sites and restaurants We really enjoyed staying there for our short break in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely city break”
Reviews.Author: TwickenhamCats
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel in an excellent location, close to the Blue mosque and other tourist attractions. Rooms were basic but comfortable and clean, perfect for a short break. Staff were helpful although to be honest, we didn't have much call on their time. The breakfast was a good selection of cereals, breads, fruit etc and perectly acceptable. The bar did not open at all during our stay. There are plently of restaurants nearby, all with waiters eager to entice you in - their persistance can get a bit wareing after a while. The food was good although most of the restaurants you come across on the main roads are clearly catering to the tourist market and the menus are all very similar. Istanbul is a very interesting city and well worth it for a city break. If you are just looking to see the main sights, 3 days is probably enough and the Erguvan an ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Puddy55
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Erguvan. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved the breakfast buffet on the roof terrace looking one way at the Blue Mosque and the other towards the Marmara Sea. Walking distance to all the attractions in the Sultanahmet and Bazaar areas. Make sure you visit the Cistern!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel WIth Good Views”
Reviews.Author: PJSNorwichUk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Erguvan. Its a small 3* hotel just 10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. A family hotel whose staff are really friendly and helpful; nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are of a good standard for a 3*, very clean and everything worked well. Only one minor problem was the outside noise from the busy back street meant that we had to keep the window closed at night and the AC on. The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque was a delight. Breakfast on the terrace with views of the Blue Mosque or the Sea of Marmara was really good with a wide range of food and drinks. All in all a lovely little hotel most suited for singles or couples. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming Little Hotel near the popular sights”
Reviews.Author: auntmimiPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We reserved three rooms at the Erguvan and found it to be charming, immaculate, comfortable and the staff incredibly helpful. The continental breakfast on the rooftop, with a spectacular view, was also incredible. Call to see if they will pick you up as the taxis have trouble finding the street or phone ahead to get the name of the larger hotel up the street that taxis would recognize and then they will find the Erguvan at the bottom of the hill. It is in walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, The Byzantine Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and The Blue Mosque. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Erguvan Hotel Went the Extra Mile”
Reviews.Author: gobiker
Reviews.Content: The Erguvan is clean, reasonable, has a great view from the terrace, and a great location. But the reason to stay there is the staff. They always helped us figure out the best way to visit sites, etc. But not only that, they really went out of their way to help us. Here are two examples: We stayed at the hotel for four days and wanted to come back and spend one more night there at the end of our trip, after touring Turkey for two weeks. They were full, but they arranged for us to stay at a higher rated hotel in the area, for the same price we paid at their hotel. When we needed a ride to the airport from the second hotel, I called the Erguvan to see if they had any suggestions, since the second hotel quoted me a high price for the trip. The Erguvan staff said the person they usually recommend was busy, so the staff used their hotel van and picked us up at the second hotel and brought us to the airport. They charged us the cheaper rate for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Roomy, Classy 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: schmelt
Reviews.Content: The Erguyan Hotel is exactly what I wanted: Centrally located, Clean, Safe, Hospitable. Add-in the free internet and it becomes a steal at only 30$ more than a private Hostel room (divide that by 2 travellers and you got a great deal). It's not near any nightime hot-spots or beach front so singles should be wary but as far as a base for your travelling in Instanbul, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Belle_and_Minni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erguvan Hotel for four nights in June 2008 after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. This was the final hotel in our 5 week trip to Europe and it was the best hotel we stayed at (and it wasn't the most expensive hotel). The rooms were immaculate, the location was fantastic and the staff were lovely. The only criticism would be that the sound proofing between the rooms wasn't great, so if you had noisey neighbours you could hear them. We would definately stay at the hotel again if we were to go back to Istanbul. Little tip ... if you are going to get a taxi back to the hotel at night, take a little map with you (there is one on the back of the hotels business card) as the taxi drivers can't find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KByrne33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erguvan for a long weekend mid-July. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and the cleaners did a fantastic job everyday. The location is very good, only a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and a fantastic artisan market. The views from the roof terrace were fantastic. The outdoor restaurant slightly up the hill and across the street from the hotel was fantastic. My only complaint about the hotel really is that the soundproofing in the hotel is terrible. You need to be a deep sleeper or not worry about noise as the cleaners start at 8am and with the hard floored hallways you can hear them banging about. Also as we were on the first floor we could hear anyone talking in the courtyard as it tends to funnel noise straight up, we could also hear the t.v the guy on the desk was watching late Saturday night (to the point I had to call and ask them to turn it down!). The beds I found to also be on the hard side. However overall a nice hotel. I would class it more in the posh backbackers level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinIrishBird
Reviews.Content: The Erguvan is an excellent small, boutique hotel with a fantastic location in a wonderful city. Very, very clean (bathrooms and linens were immaculate). Lovely decor (even the tiles in the bathroom were unique!) and very efficient and friendly service. Rooftop restaurant adds to great ambiance of hotel. The Erguvan is a top rate hotel all the way--at a price most travelers can definately afford!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: threeqs
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel Erguvan in Istanbul. I travel around the world and this hotel has a lot special features. First, the staff is exceptional in helping and friendly. English is not a problem. The breakfast is on a scenic terrace overlooking the Sea and the Blue Mosque. The Hotel is situated within easy walking of all major sights, including the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and the great Archeological Museum. Great Value for a hotel in a Great City.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Heaven28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Erguvan for 2 weeks for our honeymoon in July 2006. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and made you feel at home. It's in a convenient location with several restaurants around and a convenient store right across (great for buying water!). You can hear the call for prayer every morning and people selling in the streets. The full breakfast buffet on the hotel terrace was the best part, although repetitive (lots of selections but always the same ones...). Not a busy hotel - run by a family. There is a computer in the lobby and chess game - played a few rounds with hotel staff! lol There is a TV in the room and internet - a bit slow. Its walking distance from the blue mosque and saint sophia. Location was safe and secure. Wish i can go back! :)

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, great location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tapochek
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel, staff is courteous. Rooms are nice, bathrooms are good and clean. Beware of noise - sound insulation between rooms is not great, outside is noisy. Outside noise actually gives the authenticity of being in a MidEastern country. But it is still noisy :-) WiFi internet is available in rooms but is unbelievably slow!!!

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star but ok”
Reviews.Author: mabok
Reviews.Content: This is a homely hotel, set right at the old Hippodrome wall. Close to the Blue Mosque and other central attractions. Don't expect 4star, but clean and pleasant, and staff attentive. Advertised as full air-con but no cooling, just heating, so presumably could get stuffy in the height of summer. Free wifi is great. One internet-connected pc in lounge. Breakfast included, but quite basic, nothing hot. I presume visitors would sit at the roof-top terrace in summer to have breakfast, overlooking Marmaras Sea, and large parts of the city. Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and ideal location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: mrsadmin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Istanbul, staying at the Erguvan Hotel during snow and sleet. This hotel was a little warm haven to return to after chilly days exploring marble mosques and palaces. (yes, mad time to go but not so crowded) The location is just brilliant, literally a two minute walk round the corner to all the main tourist sites (Blue Mosque, Sophia Hagia, Topkarpi Palace etc,) and restaurants. It is also not on a main road and the modern double glazing meant no noise (unlike a lot of other Istanbul hotels). The hotel easily arranged a personalised pickup from the airport (25 Euros) which was good for a late arrival not knowing Istanbul, but we got a shared airport shuttle pickup for the return journey for only 8 Euros for 2 people just around the corner. Our room was warm and spacious, with continous hot water and a powerful shower. The only slightly down side was that (in common with all hotels in Turkey) the bed was rock hard. We asked for an extra blanket and ended up sleeping on the duvet and having blankets and sheet on top, which softened the mattrress for our old bones. There is no kettle or tea making equipment either but the staff are quite happy to make drinks for you in the bar. Indeed they cooked us a meal specially for two when we could not face the weather to get to the restaurants nearby. The free internet connection meant we could check on the hope of better weather but it is a very slow process, involving a non-English keyboard (watch out for magic i!) Our room on the third floor (34) had great views across the roofs to the Mamara Sea and the top floor terrace would have been a wonderful place to while away the afternoons with a drink in sunny weather. The view at breakfast was worth peering through the blizzard to see. Breakfast, by the way, was excellent, with a full choice of buffet items, cakes and pastries and endless drinks. Would we recommend this hotel to anyone? Certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pity about the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: pfz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the good reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel itself is nice, rooms are clean, breakfast reasonable. It's a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and well-located. I found the front desk staff indifferent at times. One got the impression that we were a distraction from the television show that she was watching in the adjoining lounge. However on another occasion she was helpful in recommending a restaurant. On balance, nothing to complain about but a disappointing aspect of an otherwise good hotel. Compared to the President Best Western Hotel in Istanbul which we have also stayed in, the Erguvan's service was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Erguvan”
Reviews.Author: Oliver27
Reviews.Content: I've recently returned home after spending a week with my mom and grandmother at hotel Erguvan. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and very accomodating. The breakfast was wonderful and so was the room service. Hotel is clean and well located, close to all the major sights and to the tram/electric streetcar. It was great that we could arrange airport pick-up for my mom and myself and for my grandmother seperately. Keep in mind that although all sites you want to see are in Sultanhamet but the food/restaurants (other than at the hotel) in the area are very mediocre and relatively overpriced compared to other areas in Istanbul, such as Taksim. If you are looking for a great cup of coffee or a snack be sure to visit Coffee World near the entrance of the Grand Bazaar. Overall, we could not have been happier that we selected to stay at the Hotel Erguvan....it was all that we could have hoped for and more. Kathy Toronto, Ontario (CANADA)

Reviews.Title: “perfect service”
Reviews.Author: tiger04
Reviews.Content: i came erguvan hotel after egypt tour istanbul is very big city.also hotel has a great location i definetly reccomend this hotel i just stay there 2 nights but its not enough for istanbul you should stay there more then 2 nights :) hotel is very clean and you can came whenever you want. reception works 24 hours. i like to breakfast too.you should visit istanbul and erguvan hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “aison”
Reviews.Author: hasabi
Reviews.Content: i stayed erguvan hotel 3 nights. i loved erguvan if i came back istanbul i will stay again there room is so clean pc is free safe box is free they have a free wireless system too. i stayed many hotel each one wants from guest money for simple things.instead of erguvan!! erguvan hotel feel you like home atmosphere.. staff friendly and helpfull 24 hours i recoomend erguvan

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: asshley
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Erguvan Hotel; The rooms are big like our want and comfortable and the bathrooms very clean. Some of the rooms have view on the Sea of Marmara. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in a great area; close to everything; Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace... They also have a good breakfast buffet and sitting outside on the terrace. staff help us everytime.when we need something they can do it quickly.when i were erguvan hotel i feel home atmosphere. i defintely reccomend this hotel.I will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Johnhb1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and could not have been more pleased. The staff were very helpful, the breakfast on the outside terrace was outstanding, and the location couldn't be beat. We were sorry to transfer to the Ritz Carlton after three nights to join our Black Sea cruise. The Ritz Carlton is everything one expects in a 5 star hotel but it is miles away from the old city. Of course we were paying as much pre night at the Ritz as for the whole time at the Erguvan. Thefre are lots of more luxurious hotels in Istanbul but few give the value one finds at the Erguvan.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: KennyN
Reviews.Content: We booked the Erguvan hotel because it was very reasonably priced and received good reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel didn't disappoint. It was small and well kept and yes it is in a great location. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast on the roof terrace was yummy with great views. Our room was tidy, the air conditioner worked like a charm, and there were numerous English language TV channels to watch while getting ready. The only down-side was Saturday morning - while you can't seem to hear your neighbours sound does seem to travel easily through the door and on Saturday people seemed to get up extremely early. We actually stayed in the Daphne Hotel the last night and it was definitely lacking compared to the Erguvan. Overall a great surprise.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: kuden
Reviews.Content: Ä± stayed erguvan hotel 24th july to 28th july hotel is amazing and staff very friendly Ä±ts my first trip to istanbul also turkey hotel is close every historical placas. Ä± can reccomend this hotel. breakfat and locotion is coozy. Ä± lÄ±ke erguvan hotel so much just one thÄ±ngs were problem for us when we came from aÄ±rport we dÄ±dnt fÄ±nd to hotel easÄ±ly. but hotel provÄ±de a shuttle servÄ±ce Ä±ts very comfortable..you should use that servÄ±ce..Ä±ts also resonable prices. Ä± want graand bazaar.Ä±ts very good places for shoppÄ±ng. We would definitely come back and stay in this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: pluvial
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was gorgeous.It was so close to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Stuff and service were one of the greatest Ä± have ever seen. The service that we had was too good for the amount we paid. Terrace and breakfast were really good. The rooms were not so big and the receptionists were not so friendly but Ä± enjoyed my visit to the Istanbul thanks to Erguvan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Creekside304
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location which is a 5- minute walk to Blue Mosque. Apart from that, it was a total disappointment. The staff wasn't friendly, the room was extremely small, smelling, and dusty. I told the taxi driver about the hotel (location, price I paid, etc.) who drove me from the airport, and as soon as we arrived at the hotel, he was surprised why I would stay in such a place instead of tens of other decent hotels in Istanbul. As a matter of fact, the first day, a friend of mine in Istanbul offered me to stay in his house instead of there. I stayed at the hotel only the last night as it's relatively close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JWiltse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Erguvan for 3 nights in mid May. We stayed in room #15 which faces the busy street. We slept with the windows open since the A/C was minimal at best and did hear some noise. If noise is a problem for you, request a room in the back. Window looks out on a blank wall, but no noise and it would be cooler since you would get no sun through the windows. The room was small and pretty basic, but for the price,68Euro if paid in cash, it was OK. No storage other than a small closet, we lived out of our suitcases. I don't think I would want to stay there for an extended period. Food was good. The best feature is the location. 10 minute walk to all the sights and the tram line. Free internet which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: CHARM2017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erguvan the week of April 18th for six nights and were pleasantly aurprised in light of some of the negative reviews posted here. We booked through United Escapes which turned out to be subcontracted thru Orbitz so I was worried at first that the Hotel had no record of us when I tried to confirm but found out from Orbitz that they do not tell the hotel until 48 hours before who is coming to the block of reserved rooms. Not to worry though since ZERO problems. Our room (#13) was very clean and the maid service excellent. Breakfast was wonderful: black olives, green olives, meats, three types of feta cheese, a braided string cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers, freshly cooked cheese fingers, potatoe blitzes, sesame bread as well as cereal and granola all in a nice buffet that opened at 8. Coffee, tea and orange juice also. Yummy. The view of the Blue Mosque from the patio is very good as well as the ancient retaining wall of the Hippodrome. Free use of the lobby computer with Internet so we could check mail and even trip advisor. Staff extremely friendly and apparently the only people in Istanbul not selling carpets. A big plus in our book. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly boutique”
Reviews.Author: Tancredi
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean cheerful boutique hotel a little distance from the other hotels in Sultanamet but still very near the tourist sites this the hotel for you The area is very safe even at night, the staff are friendly always there but not pushy, no relatives with carpet shops! Breakfast is ok nothing special and although there are sea views, and part of the Blue Mosque they are not really very spectacular Overall very good value for money and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel in a Fantastic Location, Excellent Service & Cheap!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastmeetsWestAB
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is definitely one of the great find. Location is superb particularly if this is the first time that you come and visit Istanbul. The hotel is very close to historical sites, restaurants, shops and convenience stores. Although each room does not have a safe, however the hotel does provide you with a safe facility free of charge in their office. We even have free internet access in our room. The internet service is really quick!!!! The staff here is really friendly and honest about what sites you should join a tour and what sites you can do it all by yourself. They would not pressure you to book tours with them. It is really up to you to decide. No matter how late you come back, there is always someone sitting on the front desk to welcome you. Although our room does not really have a view, however I cannot complain about it, as it is very spacious and nicely decorated. Breakfast is simple. I think I will describe continental. If you expect cooked breakfast, then this is not the hotel for you. However the terrace in this hotel is fantastic. You can see the blue mosque and see the sea!!!! On the last day, they even call a taxi for us and stay by the hotel door to wave us goodbye!!!! We would definitely come back and stay in this hotel again!!!! They make you feel so special!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ayub the Rceptionist Was nice... BUT”
Reviews.Author: Bhoodie
Reviews.Content: We arrived thinking it was a pretty good place in terms of location and initial hospitality. We got to our rooms- there were 3 of us girlfriends and we were happy that the place was ok. Our room- Number 36- the most upper and last room on the 3rd floor smelt a little musty but that was probably because as we later discovered, was the only room that was carpeted. The bathroom had a layer of scum from the previous occupants in it but we thought they'd see this on our second day and said nothing to upset anyone. When we saw that on the second day the cleaner had not cleaned the bath, we asked the kind lady at reception who was much nicer on our first day, who seemed uninterested and fobbed our comments away as she had no empathy about what we were trying to say and she said she'd deal with it. On our return we'd found our floor mats in the bathrom had not been replaced and still the scum had not been cleaned. Day 3 we tried speaking to the receptionist again and she said she knew it wasn't clean and she was on it and she was the lady to get it done. Day 3 on our return it still hadn't been done. As the receptionts are changed after a certain number of hours and they are very short staffed, the recpetionist had changed in the evening to a gentleman. I was a little angry by now as we had to shower amongst someone else's scum- so I went down to speak to someone face to face regarding the cleanliness of our room. The fellow said we were right to be annoyed but they had no cleaning products. When i mentioned our carpets were not clean from the day we moved in- he said that they were not able to give the room a clean from the last residents as they were rushed and understaffed. That was disgusting. That was not an excuse and we surely had not paid the full fee of staying there to not be provided with what we'd paid for. He told us that they usually had 2 cleaners for their 36 rooms and right then they only had 1. I said that was no excuse but as he wasn't the boss he couldn't do much about it. He said he'd go out the following morning and he'd get the detergents himself to clean the bathrooms. Day 4 the bathroom actually gets cleaned- not greatly, but atleast we couldn't feel the gritty scum when we showered in the tub. Everyday, breakfast time on the terrace, and although there was a beautiful view, there were never enough dishes to take the breakfasts on. No cups, no cutlery. As we'd complained so many times about the bathroom and the state of our room, staff who spoke english became very unco-operative there. Day 5, 6 & 7 we learnt that the bathroom wasn't being cleaned again and decided it was a waste of time to waste our energy that we wanted to store to have a good time there and stayed at friend's places where we slept and showered to avoid the nasty treatment we were getting especially from the female staff. It was a shame that we had such an awful experience that ruined a beautiful country experience. If you like to breath in clean air and like to clean yourselves in clean bathrooms- then this place is not for you. If you just want to go to sleep in and you're not too bothered about hygiene and hospitality then it's not too bad. The view from the terrace during breakfast is beautiful but it was a shame the staff weren't as beautiful as the whole of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KellyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent a week at the Erguyan Hotel in May and I could not rate them higher. This was without a doubt the most pleasant place we stayed in while travelling within Europe over four months. This hotel rates highly on all the features that I consider when looking for accommodation: staff, location, cost, room quality, breakfast. The staff at this hotel were incredible. They made us fell so welcome and we felt as if we had been welcomed into their home rather than a hotel. They seemed genuinely interested in helping us to plan our days and also to hear about what we had been up to when we got home each day. We spent quite a bit of time chatting with Bugra and Eyup and their friends who also came to visit so it was nice to spend time with locals and play backgammon with them. The location is brilliant. It is in the Sultanahmet district and is just around the corner form the blue mosque and in fact the restaurant terrace has incredible views of the Blue Mosque. This hotel is within walking district of all the main tourist attractions and loads of restaurants as well. The room was a very good size. We had a lot of luggage and we never felt like we were tripping over ourselves. The noise from the hallway can be quite loud but we never heard any noise from the adjoining rooms. Breakfast was very good with a selection of breads, fresh veges, olives, cereals, yoghurt, fruit, cakes, tea, coffee, juice, eggs. We certainly never left breakfast hungry and felt that we had eaten healthy fresh food. The rate for this room was very reasonable. It is much better than some of the hotels at the top of this list however they would need to be flawless to consider paying the additional money. I was very happy with the value for money. Thank you to everyone at the Erguyan Hotel for making our stay so enjoyable. I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: holydolly
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the end of June and found the hotel lovely. We paid the extra 10 euros to get a room with a view, and got a nice and quiet room on the third floor. The hotel internet site reflects well the hotel itself, and we liked the elegant and not overwhelming decoration of the room. Found the breakfast on the terrace especially pleasing â€“ a good and fresh variety with a nice view. The location couldnâ€™t be better â€“ it also enabled us to come back to the hotel after lunch and rest a little before continuing our sightseeing. Just bear in mind that it is a bit of a climb from the hotel to the main sights (so it's less recommended for older people) â€“ but for young couples it's simply great!!!

Reviews.Title: “A simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Therese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 2-night stay at this hotel. The location is convenient. However we had trouble with the aircond in the room - it gave out a stale smell that lasts. We had to strongly insist before transfer us to another room. Luckily the alternative room was nicer however we had to compromise on the bathroom size. The room and bathroom were clean. The shower works well. The staff were friendly except for the ones in the terrace restaurant. It would do well if they could smile and help provide a friendly atmosphere. Our nightcap at the terrace with the view of the Golden Horn was beautiful and peaceful. I would rate this an average boutique hotel.
